poem:
The Lens of Motherhood

With old camera in hand,  
Trace the threads of daily days—  
A single mother, once director,   
now director still.   
Her son grows frame by frame,  
time's quiet applause.  
From motherhood's lens,  
a life insists upon  
the coaxing light,  
the quiet shadow.
